results.title: Acute and Chronic Pretreatment With Atenolol Attenuates Intestinal Ischemia and Reperfusion Injury in Hypercholesterolemic Rats.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Both chronic and acute pre-@<m>DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@I/R injury@@@ treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ attenuated @<m>DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@I/R injury@@@ in this @DISEASE_Hyperlipoproteinemia_Type_II @DISEASE_MESH:D006938 @@@hypercholesterolemic@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ model.

citations.NLM: Öztürk T, Vural K, Tuğlu İ, Var A, Kurdal T, Aydemir I. Acute and Chronic Pretreatment With Atenolol Attenuates Intestinal Ischemia and Reperfusion Injury in Hypercholesterolemic Rats. J Cardiothorac Vasc Anesth. 2016 Aug;30(4):985-92. PMID: 27521968

results.title: The role of atenolol in the modulation of the expression of genes encoding pro- (caspase-1) and anti- (Bcl2L1) apoptotic proteins in endothelial cells exposed to intestinal ischemia and reperfusion in rats.
results.text_hl: METHODS: Eighteen adult male Wistar @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were randomly divided into 3 groups (n=6): SG (Sham group): no clamping of the superior mesenteric artery; IRG: @<m>DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@IR@@@ plus saline group: IRG+At: @<m>DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@IR@@@ plus @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Taha MO, Silva TMAE, Ota KS, Vilela WJ, Simões RS, Starzewski Junior A, Fagundes DJ. The role of atenolol in the modulation of the expression of genes encoding pro- (caspase-1) and anti- (Bcl2L1) apoptotic proteins in endothelial cells exposed to intestinal ischemia and reperfusion in rats. Acta Cir Bras. 2018 Dec;33(12):1061-1066. PMID: 30624511
